caption.p: ( a) Observed spatiotemporal dynamics of measles in England and Wales, showing weekly aggregate time series of notifications for London. ( b) Basic flows of individuals captured by the SEIR model. ( c) Schematic time series of numbers of susceptible individuals, arising from flows in panel b, and in particular following the introduction of one infectious individual into a wholly susceptible population; the effect of birth rate on susceptibility is ignored. ( d) Corresponding dynamics for the proportion of the population susceptible (line marked “ S”) and the proportion infected (line marked “ I”) ( b, d: Taken from Fig. 2, Grenfell [ 6]. Figure found on p. 38)
